title: RAISINS
text: South Park Elementary playrgound, recess or lunch. The camera pans across the playground and settles on two teams of seven players each. A football lies on the ground between the two groups. The group left of the football consists of Stan, Kyle, Cartman, Kenny, Butters, Token, and Clyde. The second includes Craig, Tweek, Kevin, Pip, and three others

title: RAISINS
text: All right, you guys, it's first down. I'll hike the ball on the third "set hut!" Kyle and Cartman, go deep post out. Kenny, run a slant down the middle. Butters, be ready for the screen.

title: RAISINS
text: Right. What are we playing again?

title: RAISINS
text: Football.

title: RAISINS
text: Got it.

title: RAISINS
text: Okay. 23!  Blue, 23! Set hut! Set hut!

title: RAISINS
text: Wendy breaks up.

title: RAISINS
text: What?

title: RAISINS
text: Wendy breaks up with you.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh whoa, wait a minute.  What did I do wrong? I haven't even talked to Wendy for weeks.

title: RAISINS
text: She just doesn't wanna be with you anymore. She said she still wants to be friends.

title: RAISINS
text: What-ever, Bebe! Like Stan really cares! Just get out of our football game, you stupid skank!

title: RAISINS
text: Fuck you, fatass! You guys are assholes!

title: RAISINS
text: Oh yeah? Huwell, at least we have assholes, you dumb girl!

title: RAISINS
text: Yeh-heah, right!

title: RAISINS
text: God, you're so stupid!

title: RAISINS
text: What a whore!

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah! Like Stan gives a crap if Wendy breaks up!  Stan?

title: RAISINS
text: Come on, Stan, it's first down still.

title: RAISINS
text: Stan is next seen walking onto a small red stone bridge. The next scene has him walking down the middle of a two-lane road in the rain. He stops to take in the moist air. The next scene has him back on the bridge, looking over the creek with his head on his right hand. On the water he sees a reflection of Wendy walk up to him. She's smiling. He brightens as she approaches. He turns to greet her, but there's no one to greet. He looks back at the creek, then turns around and walks off. The next scene has him at a rainy night sitting on the curb in a run-down part of town, under a working street light, with his face buried in his legs, crying. The last scene has him in his room, sitting on the floor by his bed, looking at a picture of Wendy. He gently strokes the picture, which has Wendy holding a daisy and smiling broadly. On the picture are written the words "I love you forever. Wendy." The image fades to black

title: RAISINS
text: South Park Elementary, day. In the hallway Craig goes to a drinking fountain for a drink of water. Fosse and Dog Poo walk towards the camera. Stan is at the far end watching Wendy open her locker. Stan looks away and walks towards Kyle, who's seated next to his locker reading a book.

title: RAISINS
text: Kyle, will you talk to Wendy for me?

title: RAISINS
text: Why?

title: RAISINS
text: 'Cause I need to know why she broke up.

title: RAISINS
text: Aw, dude, come on. I gotta do my science homework.

title: RAISINS
text: Dude, please. I might still have a chance to make things work. Please, just go talk to her?

title: RAISINS
text: God damnit!  Wendy, Stan wants to know why you break up.

title: RAISINS
text: Look, Stan is really nice. I just don't wanna be boyfriend and girlfriend anymore. I've been wanting to break up for a while. but it's, it's nothing against him.

title: RAISINS
text: 'K.  She says she's been wantin' to break up for a while, and it's nothing against you.

title: RAISINS
text: What? That's no answer!  Go tell her to be more direct with me.

title: RAISINS
text: No dude, I'm out. Go talk to her yourself. Be poetic.

title: RAISINS
text: Kyle, this is my life.  Jimmy!

title: RAISINS
text: Hey Stan.

title: RAISINS
text: Jimmy, will you go talk to Wendy for me?

title: RAISINS
text: For- Forw- Forw-w-w what?

title: RAISINS
text: Just go talk to her an, and be poetic. Tell her she's my Muse-no! Tell her, tell her...  she's a con-tinuing source of inspiration to me.

title: RAISINS
text: She's what?

title: RAISINS
text: She's a continuing source of inspiration to me.

title: RAISINS
text: ...Okay.  Hey uh-Wen, hey wu-Wemdy.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah?

title: RAISINS
text: Stan says your a cont... you're a- cont- S-Stan says you're a cont- cont-

title: RAISINS
text: Well tell Stan to stop!!

title: RAISINS
text: -cont- You're a cont-tinuing source of inspiration to him.

title: RAISINS
text: Well?

title: RAISINS
text: She just- w-walked away, Stan. You're gonna have to face facts. It's over.

title: RAISINS
text: Over?  Jesus...

title: RAISINS
text: We came over to cheer you up, Stan!

title: RAISINS
text: ...Go away.

title: RAISINS
text: Stan, you can't keep doing this to yourself. You have to go live.

title: RAISINS
text: Why? What's the point of living when the only girl I ever loved is gone?

title: RAISINS
text: God, what a fag!

title: RAISINS
text: Dude, not now!

title: RAISINS
text: You guys have no idea how this feels. It's like, you always hear songs about a broken heart and you think it's just a figure of speech? But it's true. My chest hurts. I feel this like, sinking feeling where my heart is. It's broken...

title: RAISINS
text: Jeez, he's worse than I thought.

title: RAISINS
text: Well what do we do now?

title: RAISINS
text: Should I try telling him a fa-fantastic joke?

title: RAISINS
text: No. We just have to show him that there's other girls out there. I say we take him to Raisins.

title: RAISINS
text: What's Raisins?

title: RAISINS
text: Next day, Raisins, a Hooters-like restaurant with al-fresco dining. The boys enter the restaurant, and a pretty little girl in a Raisins outfit walks up. Other girls walk around, all seem to work there

title: RAISINS
text: Hey guys, welcome to Raisins. Six of you?  Right over here.

title: RAISINS
text: So you guys having a good time today?

title: RAISINS
text: Uh huh...

title: RAISINS
text: How about some more fun fries, guys?

title: RAISINS
text: Okay...

title: RAISINS
text: Boy, am I glad you guys came in. Everyone here is such a loser, but you guys seem really cool.

title: RAISINS
text: Here you go, guys. Lexus will be right with you.

title: RAISINS
text: What do you think, Stan. These girls are pretty cute, huh?

title: RAISINS
text: Jesus Christ, I think I've died and... gone to... heaven.

title: RAISINS
text: This place is awesome!

title: RAISINS
text: How do you know? We haven't even tried the food yet.

title: RAISINS
text: Hey guys.

title: RAISINS
text: Whoa!

title: RAISINS
text: How are we doing this afternoon?

title: RAISINS
text: Good.

title: RAISINS
text: I'm so glad you guys came in. Everyone here is such a loser, but you guys seem really cool.

title: RAISINS
text: W-we are.

title: RAISINS
text: So what can I get you?

title: RAISINS
text: Okay, um, we're gonna get the zingy tangy wings, and mozzarella tasty tarts and uh, OH, and the bite-size pizzazzas, and a pitcher of lemonade.

title: RAISINS
text: Great. I'll put your order in right now.

title: RAISINS
text: You guys! I think our Raisins girl likes me. She, she touched my back when she walked away. Did you see that?

title: RAISINS
text: Raisins, girls!

title: RAISINS
text: Woohoo!

title: RAISINS
text: Oh Yeah!

title: RAISINS
text: Do it!

title: RAISINS
text: Hey. Hey, look over there, Stan. That Raisins girl is really cure, huh?  Why don't you say hi to her?  Excuse me?

title: RAISINS
text: Hi guys. My name's Porsche.

title: RAISINS
text: Hey. Uh, this is Stan.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh hey cutie. How are you? I love your hat. I used to have a hat juuust like that, except, it was black and it didn't have a puffball on it. Oh my God, my hands are sooo cold. How come people have hands, anyway? Did you ever wonder that?

title: RAISINS
text: Some time later, still dining. The Village People's "YMCA" begins to play, and some Raisins girls begin to dance

title: RAISINS
text: YMCA...  YMCA-A.

title: RAISINS
text: Omigod! You guys... this is the greatest place in the world...

title: RAISINS
text: Have you ever noticed how much sand there is at the beach? I mean, haven't you ever wondered where all this sand came from? Omigod, this one time, I saw a beetle that was thiiis big. Eeewww!

title: RAISINS
text: Can we go, please?

title: RAISINS
text: Okay. Okay, come on you guys.

title: RAISINS
text: Oooh my God, thank you guys sooo much for coming to Raisins!

title: RAISINS
text: Oooh, sweetie, are you leaving?

title: RAISINS
text: Well, I don't want to, Lexus, but my stupid friends wanna go.

title: RAISINS
text: Awww, well, when am I gonna get to see you again??

title: RAISINS
text: When do you wanna see me?

title: RAISINS
text: As soon as possible!

title: RAISINS
text: Oh my God! Here, we left you a tip already, but here is another five dollars.

title: RAISINS
text: Oooh, you are such a sweetie. Come here, youuu!

title: RAISINS
text: Waa... ahaaah...

title: RAISINS
text: Bye, guys! Thanks for coming to Raisins!

title: RAISINS
text: Well, Stan. Do you feel, uhb- better now?

title: RAISINS
text: No, dude, I feel worse!

title: RAISINS
text: Look, we're just trying to show you there's other girls out there.

title: RAISINS
text: Dude, I don't have time to start over with other girls. I'm nine years old, dude! If I don't work things out with Wnedy, I could be alone my whole life!

title: RAISINS
text: She wants to see me again! My Raisins girl said she wants to see me again!

title: RAISINS
text: I can't let Wendy go. This whole time I've been having my friends do all thealking for me. It's time I took control!

title: RAISINS
text: What are you doing?

title: RAISINS
text: Something I should have done a long time ago.

title: RAISINS
text: Bebe's house, night. Stan walks towards the fromt door, looks around, and knocks three times. No response, so he knocks again. The door opens and Bebe appears

title: RAISINS
text: Bebe, you need to go talk to Wendy for me right now!  All this time I've been trying to have my friends do all the talking for me! Now I realize I need her friends to do it! Tell her I love her!

title: RAISINS
text: Stan, why don't you show her you love her? If you really want Wendy back, try doing the most romantic thing you can think of.

title: RAISINS
text: Okay, so what's the most romantic thing I can think of?

title: RAISINS
text: If you really want a shot at getting her back, stand outside her window, hold a boombox over your head, and play Peter Gabriel.

title: RAISINS
text: Wendy's house, night. Stan stands on the lawn with a boombox, looking up at Wendy's window. He presses the play button and holds up the boombox. Peter Gabriel's "Shock the Monkey" plays from somewhere in the middle. Wendy appears at the window and looks down, her jaw dropping. Stan holds the boombox higher, keeping Wendy's gaze on him. Wendy covers her mouth as Token appears next to her at the window. Stan's jaw drops. Wendy leaves the window. Token unleashes the curtain ties, and the curtains close upon the window

title: RAISINS
text: Raisins, night, outside. The outside lights turn off. Butters waits outside on the curb with a present. The front door opens and Lexus appears. Butters rises to greet her

title: RAISINS
text: Okay, Porsche, see you tomorrow. Bye, Mercedes.

title: RAISINS
text: Lexus!

title: RAISINS
text: Uh oh. Uh, hi, sweetie.

title: RAISINS
text: I waited all night for you to get off work.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh, really?  Huhunh, that's great. Uhm, Maury...

title: RAISINS
text: I I just could- I just couldn't stop thinking about you.

title: RAISINS
text: There a problem?

title: RAISINS
text: Could you uh just help walk me to my- bike?

title: RAISINS
text: Right.

title: RAISINS
text: Thanks again for the big tip. You are such a sweetie. Come back and see me real soon, okay?

title: RAISINS
text: Oh wait, Lexus. Jeheez, I almost forgot. Ah I got you this present.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh wow. Thanks, cutie.

title: RAISINS
text: It's a little stuffed bear dressed as a rabbit.

title: RAISINS
text: Gosh, that's the nicest gift I've gotten all night. Thank you.  Well I gotta go, honey. Be sure to come back to Raisins and see me again, okaaay?

title: RAISINS
text: Well yeah, but, but, hey,  hey Lexus? Well I was thinking, well, I was thinking that we should- go do something sometime.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh gee, that would be great, honey, but I'm reeeally busy this week. Tell you what: you come back to Raisins and then we'll be able to hang out all we want, okay?

title: RAISINS
text: O-kay!

title: RAISINS
text: Bye, cutie!

title: RAISINS
text: Bye, bye darling!  Wow... a real-life relationship.

title: RAISINS
text: South Park Elementary, day. All the boys are in various stages of dress. Most of them are in their P.E. uniforms

title: RAISINS
text: All right, kids! Out on the gym floor for P.E. class.

title: RAISINS
text: Come on, Stan. We're gonna play dodgeball.

title: RAISINS
text: I can't believe it. She's in love with somebody else.

title: RAISINS
text: Dude, you need to snap out of this! So Wendy left you for Token. What are you gonna do? Just be miserable your whole life?

title: RAISINS
text: There's nothing else I can do. She was my whole life.

title: RAISINS
text: Aw, come on, dude! All you've done for the last four days is mope around! You might as well hang out with those Goth kids who dress in black and talk about pain all the time!

title: RAISINS
text: Maybe I should. At least they will understand me. Maybe I should hang with the Goth kids.

title: RAISINS
text: South Park Elementary, loading bay. Stan finds the boys

title: RAISINS
text: Life is pain. Life is only pain.  We're all taught to believe in happy fairytale endings.  But there's only blackness. Dark, depressing loneliness that  eats at your soul.

title: RAISINS
text: Who needs that kind of Barbie love, anyway? Everyone's just walking around like a bunch of conforminsts. Go ahead and wear your business suits so you can make thirty-four thousand dollars a year to buy your condominium. They're all zombies racing to their graves. Love didn't work for my mom and dad. Why should it work for me?

title: RAISINS
text: My dad is such an asshole. Drunken bastard doesn't even know I exist. But then he won't let me go to the Skinny Puppy concert because my heroine-addict aunt is coming over for dinner.  Dinner? That's a laugh. Just an excuse for my mom to bitch at me for not wearing girly clothes like all the Britney Spears wannabes at this school.

title: RAISINS
text: They're all a bunch of Nazi conformists cheerleaders.

title: RAISINS
text: But if life is only pain, then... what's the point of living?

title: RAISINS
text: Just to make life more miserable for the conformists.

title: RAISINS
text: All right, so how do I join you?

title: RAISINS
text: If you wanna be one of the non-conformists, all you have to do is dress just like us and listen to the same music we do.

title: RAISINS
text: Raisins, day. Raisins is preparing for a new day of food and fun. Mercedes escorts a new employee around

title: RAISINS
text: Okay, I know it's your first day, Ferrari, so I wanna go over the basics with you.

title: RAISINS
text: Okay.

title: RAISINS
text: First of all, there's a five foot rule. If you come within five feet of a customer, you need to acknowledge them, even if they're not at your table. "Hey, cudie." When you're not serving food or talking with customers, you need to dance around and have fun.  We use things like Hula Hoops, silly strings, and water guns to play with the other girls. Be sure to giggle a lot, and be sure to show off your raisins.  Now, when you take a customer's order, you need to sit down at the table with them and make them think you're interested. Write your name down for them and make them feel special. "Oh man, I am so bored. Thank God you guys came in." If you want good tips, the most important thing is physical contact. Just a simple hold of the arm can mean the difference between five and twenty dollars. "I'll be right back with your order, guys."

title: RAISINS
text: Wow, thank you so much, Mercedes.

title: RAISINS
text: Okay. Well, I guess we're ready to open for business. Good luck.  Go ahead and open for business, Porsche!

title: RAISINS
text: Okay!

title: RAISINS
text: Hi, welcome to Raisins!

title: RAISINS
text: Hi! Is Lexus here?

title: RAISINS
text: Hey, cutie.

title: RAISINS
text: Darling!

title: RAISINS
text: How are we doing today?

title: RAISINS
text: Oh God. I missed you so much.

title: RAISINS
text: The Goth girl's room. It's quite the room, with posters for Happy Puppy and the Nothing Matters tour, a Blauhaus poster, candles all around, a mace on the floor, cigarettes next to a book, an ornate candelabrum and chair, and a darkened atmosphere.

title: RAISINS
role: Drowning alone, I gasp for air.

title: RAISINS
role: There is sadness so deep it pulls me down

title: RAISINS
role: Happiness dies in a deep, dark sea.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah, happiness dies.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.

title: RAISINS
text: All right, your turn, Stan. Read one of your poems about pain.

title: RAISINS
role: There is darkness all around me

title: RAISINS
role: Deep, piercing black, I cannot breathe

title: RAISINS
text: Whoa.

title: RAISINS
text: The pain is everlasting.

title: RAISINS
role: I miss you so much, babe.

title: RAISINS
role: Want to hold you in my arms again, girl.

title: RAISINS
text: Whoa, whoa! Dude! Those last two lines aren't Goth!

title: RAISINS
text: They're not?

title: RAISINS
text: No, dude! You can't say "I miss you so much, babe. I want to hold you in my arms."

title: RAISINS
text: Make it "I miss seeing you so much I wanna slash my eyes out with razor blades."

title: RAISINS
text: Henrietta! Hi sweetie!

title: RAISINS
text: Go away Mom! Leave me alone!

title: RAISINS
text: Daddy and I just got your birthday present! But you can't see what it is till tomorrow!

title: RAISINS
text: You'd like to wait till I was dead, wouldn't you? You'd like to see maggots eat my face.

title: RAISINS
text: Ee-you are so creative, honey.

title: RAISINS
text: Conformist bitch.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.

title: RAISINS
text: Raisins, day. Two of the Raisins girls are entertaining the child customers, who respond enthusiatically. The phone rings and Porsche arrives to answer it.

title: RAISINS
text: Thanks for calling Raisins. This is Porsche. Have you tried our Double Whammy Wings?

title: RAISINS
text: Hi. Is Lexus there, please? This is her boyfriend.

title: RAISINS
text: Thanks for calling Raisins. This is Lexus.

title: RAISINS
text: Hey Lexus.

title: RAISINS
text: Hi, sweetie! Who's this?

title: RAISINS
text: Wuh it's me, Butters.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh, okay. Hi, cutie.  Hey sweetie. So how are you, honey?

title: RAISINS
text: I'm fine. I miss you though.  Yeah, school was pretty tough today. We had two quizzes, and one of them was a pop quiz.  Sometimes I think our classes are too hard.  But I thought about you all day long. I promise. So how is your day going?

title: RAISINS
text: Good, good.

title: RAISINS
text: Hey, hey sweetie, I was thinking tonight you could come over and we could watch The Exorcist on DVD.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh, gee, I don't know, cutie.  Why don't you just come down to Raisins?

title: RAISINS
text: Oh well, uh I kinda don't have any money left. Unh, I spent it all on Raisins the last six times.

title: RAISINS
text: Awww, that's too bad, cutie. I really wanna see you.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh, I really wanna see you too, baby. Eh don't, don't worry. I'll get more money

title: RAISINS
text: 'K sugar. Gotta run.

title: RAISINS
text: Uh-okay. Uh, hey, Lexus, well, there's something I've been meaning to say. Here it goes: Lexus, I- Oh jeeze, maybe I shouldn't say it- no wait, I want to say it. I love you.  Heeheee, heh, Oh my God.

title: RAISINS
text: Butters' house, living room. Butters arrives there moments later and faces the couch

title: RAISINS
text: Dad, I need an advance on my allowance again.

title: RAISINS
text: O-hoo no Butters! You got an advance two days ago.

title: RAISINS
text: Uh but I spent it all.

title: RAISINS
text: What are you spending all that money on, Butters?

title: RAISINS
text: On my girlfriend.

title: RAISINS
text: Girlfriend?

title: RAISINS
text: You... have a girlfriend, Butters?

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.

title: RAISINS
text: And she's... a... girl, right?

title: RAISINS
text: Yup!

title: RAISINS
text: Well all right! Good for you, Butters!

title: RAISINS
text: Oh, that is so cute. When do we get to meet her?

title: RAISINS
text: Well, I was hopin' to go see her right now. You can come alone.  But don't embarass me or nothin'.  I'm sure she'll be real nervous to impress you.

title: RAISINS
text: Don't worry, Butters. We just wanna say hi and then we'll leave you two alone.

title: RAISINS
text: Okay.

title: RAISINS
text: You see? I told you he wouldn't turn out gay.

title: RAISINS
text: All right, you win.

title: RAISINS
text: Benny's, night. "We're always open." The Goth kids are seated at a booth drinking coffee. A middle-aged waitress walks by with a pot of coffee

title: RAISINS
text: Hey, can we get more coffee over here?

title: RAISINS
text: Damnit, are you kids just gonna sit here all night again and drink six dollars' work of coffee?! Why don't you get a life?!

title: RAISINS
text: Conformist. Have fun in your rat-race life, living paycheck to paycheck for corporate gains.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.

title: RAISINS
text: Dude, you haven't drank your coffee.

title: RAISINS
text: Well I don't drink coffee.

title: RAISINS
text: You can't be a non-conformist if you don't drink coffee.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh Jesus Christ, I had to see it to believe it! What the hell are you doing?!

title: RAISINS
text: Breathing deep in darkness that envelops my soul.

title: RAISINS
text: God-damnit dude, your mom and dad want you to come home!

title: RAISINS
text: So they can fill my head with more Disney lies about how perfect the world is? I don't think so.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah. Why don't you just go back to your Justin Timberlake and your homework, you conformist asshole?  You just don't know what real pain is.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh, like you know what pain is! Go try living in a Third-World country, you little pussy!

title: RAISINS
text: I'm not gonna live in a Third-World country with all the conforminsts.

title: RAISINS
text: Stan, this is it. Time to stop feeling sorry for yourself and come home! Everyone cares about you and everyone wants you back!

title: RAISINS
text: What about Wendy? Isn't she still with Token?

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah. She is.

title: RAISINS
text: Then people shouldn't care about me-ehhh. Because I don't care about them. What's the point of caring if all it brings is pain?

title: RAISINS
text: For sure.

title: RAISINS
text: Fine. That's it. I give up. Have fun being miserable.

title: RAISINS
text: ...conformist.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.

title: RAISINS
text: Raisins, night. Butters and his parents arrive.

title: RAISINS
text: Here we are, Mom and Dad!

title: RAISINS
text: Hi, welcome to Raisins. Three of you?

title: RAISINS
text: Hi, Mercedes. It's me, Lexus's boyfriend. I brought my parents over to meet her.

title: RAISINS
text: Great.  Be sure to try our Cheddar Poppers. Right this way.

title: RAISINS
text: Who else wants a signed Raisins Girls calendar for five dollars?

title: RAISINS
text: Woohoo, all right, yeah!

title: RAISINS
text: Stephen, what is this place?

title: RAISINS
text: I, don't know.

title: RAISINS
text: Here you go. Porsche will by right with you.

title: RAISINS
text: Go ahead and have a seat, guys. Ah I've gotta go and find Lexus!

title: RAISINS
text: Hey cutie, you having a good time?

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh boy, I think I know what's happened. Our son hasn't learned yet that girls will pretend to like him for money.

title: RAISINS
text: This place is horrible. To objectify girls like this.

title: RAISINS
text: Hi guys. Can I take your order?

title: RAISINS
text: Little girl, you shouldn't be working here.

title: RAISINS
text: I shouldn't? Where I supposed to be working?

title: RAISINS
text: No, I mean you shouldn't work somewhere where you're paid for how you look. You should be learning a skill so you can grow up to be a businesswoman or even a doctor. Who knows? You could cure cancer.

title: RAISINS
text: I could cure cancer? Omigod! That would be sooo cool! I had a cancer sore on my lip once and it hurt sooo bad.

title: RAISINS
text: ... Oh. Never mind, I think Raisins might be the perfect place for you.

title: RAISINS
text: Cool!

title: RAISINS
text: Mom? Dad? This is Lexus.

title: RAISINS
text: Hi. Welcome to Raisins.

title: RAISINS
text: Uh, Butters, can we have a little talk with you? Outside?

title: RAISINS
text: Huh? Oh anything you have to say to me  you can say in front of Lexus.

title: RAISINS
text: Butters, these girls pretend to be interested in you because they know you'll give them tips.

title: RAISINS
text: Huh?

title: RAISINS
text: You see, Butters, women know that they can make men do anything by flirting. And some girls, like these, turn that into a profession.

title: RAISINS
text: Oh, I see.  You don't approve of my girlfriend!  Well let me tell you somethin', Mom and Dad, our love is as pure as a mountain spring! The odds may be stacked against us, but we're gonna give it our best shot! And so, if you can't be happy for us, y-you can just go to heck, Mom and Dad!  Come on, Lexus. I'm movin' out of my parents' house and I'm movin' in with you. Uh let's blow this joint!

title: RAISINS
text: What are you talking about, kid? We are NOT boyfriend and girlfriend.

title: RAISINS
text: ... What? Lexus, what are you saying? Are you saying... you don't want to be together anymore?

title: RAISINS
text: I'm sorry, sweetie.

title: RAISINS
text: So that's it? We're broken up now?

title: RAISINS
text: I gotta get these curly fries to Table 12.

title: RAISINS
text: Well go ahead and go. It's best we don't say anything more. There's nothing left to say. It's over.  Our relationship is o-over.

title: RAISINS
text: Run-down part of town, night. The conditions surrounding Stan's presence there a week ago are present again, and Butters sobs at the same spot Stan did, at the curb under a working street light. Some shadows move in on him and stop when they cover most of his head

title: RAISINS
text: Look at this. Another tortured soul. Another life of pain.  Hey Raven, check it out.

title: RAISINS
text: Butters?

title: RAISINS
text: Oh  Uh hey, hey Stan.

title: RAISINS
text: What's the matter with you?

title: RAISINS
text: Well, mu mu mu girlfriend broke up with me.

title: RAISINS
text: Did she step on your heart with stiletto heels?

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.  It sure does hurt.

title: RAISINS
text: That's cool. I guess you can join up with us if you want.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah. We're gonna go to the graveyard and write poems about death and how pointless life is.

title: RAISINS
text: Uh, uhm no thanks. I I love life.

title: RAISINS
text: Huh? But you just got dumped

title: RAISINS
text: Wuh-ell yeah, and I'm sad, but at the same time I'm really happy that somethin' could make me feel that sad. It's like, ih ih, ih it makes me feel alive, you know? It makes me feel human. And the only way I could feel this sad now is if I felt somethin' really good before. So I have to take the bad with the good, so I guess what I'm feelin' is like a, beautiful sadness. I guess that sounds stupid...

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah.

title: RAISINS
text: No. No, Butters, that doesn't sound stupid at all.

title: RAISINS
text: Well, thanks for offerin' to let me in your clique, guys, uh but, to be honest, I'd rather be a cryin' little pussy than a faggy Goth kid. Well see ya, Stan.

title: RAISINS
text: He's right. I don't even know who I am anymore. I like liking life a whole lot more than hating it. Screw you guys, I'm goin' home.

title: RAISINS
text: Go ahead and go back to your sunshine fairytale!

title: RAISINS
text: South Park Elementary, playground. The school kids are back at play. The same two teams face off, except that Bill has replaced Token on Stan's team, and Stan hasn't arrived yet

title: RAISINS
text: Okay, it's third down. And now, somebody make a play!

title: RAISINS
text: Hey, can I join in?

title: RAISINS
text: What happened? Aren't you still wallowing in pain?

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah, it still hurts a lot, but ...I just realized that there's gonna be a lot of painful times in life, so, I'd better learn to deal with it the right way.  Hey Wendy!  You're a bitch. Token?  Right here, buddy.

title: RAISINS
text: Well. Dude, it's uh it's good to have you back.

title: RAISINS
text: Yeah. Let's play ball.
